medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Patient reports about one week of abdominal pain that started after cholecystectomy, initially colicky and mid-epigastric. Pain improved temporarily but then re-escalated, becoming significant again with radiation to the back and left flank. Associated symptoms include nausea and one episode of emesis.
medical_history.family_history: Father s/p CABG x 4; Mother healthy.
